text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
EvidenceVariable TUMetadataResourceA definition of an exposure, outcome, or other variable
+ Warning: Name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation
Elements defined in Ancestors: id, meta, implicitRules, language, text, contained, extension, modifierExtension, url, identifier, version, name, title, status, experimental, date, publisher, contact, description, useContext, jurisdiction, purpose, copyright, approvalDate, lastReviewDate, effectivePeriod, topic, author, editor, reviewer, endorser, relatedArtifact
url Σ0..1uriCanonical identifier for this evidence variable, represented as a URI (globally unique)
identifier Σ0..*IdentifierAdditional identifier for the evidence variable
version Σ0..1stringBusiness version of the evidence variable
name ΣI0..1stringName for this evidence variable (computer friendly)
title Σ0..1stringName for this evidence variable (human friendly)
shortTitle Σ0..1stringTitle for use in informal contexts
subtitle 0..1stringSubordinate title of the EvidenceVariable
status ?!Σ1..1codedraft | active | retired | unknown
PublicationStatus (Required)
experimental 0..1booleanFor testing purposes, not real usage
date Σ0..1dateTimeDate last changed
publisher Σ0..1stringName of the publisher (organization or individual)
contact Σ0..*ContactDetailContact details for the publisher
description Σ0..1markdownNatural language description of the evidence variable
note 0..*AnnotationUsed for footnotes or explanatory notes
useContext Σ0..*UsageContextThe context that the content is intended to support
copyright 0..1markdownUse and/or publishing restrictions
approvalDate 0..1dateWhen the resource was approved by publisher
lastReviewDate 0..1dateWhen the resource was last reviewed
effectivePeriod 0..1PeriodWhen the resource is expected to be used
author 0..*ContactDetailWho authored the content
editor 0..*ContactDetailWho edited the content
reviewer 0..*ContactDetailWho reviewed the content
endorser 0..*ContactDetailWho endorsed the content
relatedArtifact 0..*RelatedArtifactAdditional documentation, citations, etc.
actual 0..1booleanActual or conceptual
characteristic ΣI0..*BackboneElementA defining factor of the EvidenceVariable
+ Rule: In a characteristic, at most one of these seven elements shall be used: definitionReference or definitionCanonical or definitionCodeableConcept or definitionExpression or definitionId or definitionByTypeAndValue or definitionByCombination
linkId 0..1idLabel for internal linking
description 0..1stringNatural language description of the characteristic
note 0..*AnnotationUsed for footnotes or explanatory notes
exclude 0..1booleanWhether the characteristic includes or excludes members
definitionReference ΣI0..1Reference(EvidenceVariable | Group | Evidence)Defines the characteristic (without using type and value) by a Reference
definitionCanonical ΣI0..1canonical(EvidenceVariable | Group | Evidence)Defines the characteristic (without using type and value) by a Canonical
definitionCodeableConcept ΣI0..1CodeableConceptDefines the characteristic (without using type and value) by a CodeableConcept
definitionExpression ΣI0..1ExpressionDefines the characteristic (without using type and value) by a Expression
definitionId ΣI0..1idDefines the characteristic (without using type and value) by a id
definitionByTypeAndValue ΣI0..1BackboneElementDefines the characteristic using type and value
type[x] Σ1..1Expresses the type of characteristic
UsageContextType (Example)
typeCodeableConceptCodeableConcept
typeReferenceReference(EvidenceVariable)
typeIdid
value[x] Σ1..1Defines the characteristic when coupled with characteristic.type[x]
valueCodeableConceptCodeableConcept
valueBooleanboolean
valueQuantityQuantity
valueRangeRange
valueReferenceReference()
valueIdid
offset 0..1CodeableConceptReference point for valueQuantity
CharacteristicOffset (Example)
definitionByCombination I0..1BackboneElementUsed to specify how two or more characteristics are combined
code 1..1codeall-of | any-of | at-least | at-most | statistical | net-effect | dataset
CharacteristicCombination (Required)
threshold 0..1positiveIntProvides the value of "n" when "at-least" or "at-most" codes are used
characteristic 1..*see characteristicA defining factor of the characteristic
method 0..*CodeableConceptMethod used for describing characteristic
CharacteristicMethod (Example)
device 0..1Reference(Device | DeviceMetric)Device used for determining characteristic
timeFromEvent 0..*BackboneElementObservation time from study specified event
description 0..1stringHuman readable description
note 0..*AnnotationUsed for footnotes or explanatory notes
event[x] 0..1The event used as a base point (reference point) in time
EvidenceVariableEvent (Example)
eventCodeableConceptCodeableConcept
eventReferenceReference()
eventDateTimedateTime
eventIdid
quantity 0..1QuantityUsed to express the observation at a defined amount of time after the study start
range 0..1RangeUsed to express the observation within a period after the study start
groupMeasure 0..1codemean | median | mean-of-mean | mean-of-median | median-of-mean | median-of-median
GroupMeasure (Required)
handling 0..1codecontinuous | dichotomous | ordinal | polychotomous
EvidenceVariableHandling (Required)
category 0..*BackboneElementA grouping for ordinal or polychotomous variables
name 0..1stringDescription of the grouping
value[x] 0..1Definition of the grouping
valueCodeableConceptCodeableConcept
valueQuantityQuantity
valueRangeRange

Documentation for this format

name: EvidenceVariable
publisher: Health Level Seven International (Clinical Decision Support)
description: The EvidenceVariable resource describes an element that knowledge (Evidence) is about.
purpose: Need to be able to define and reuse the definition of individual elements of a research question.

element.short: A definition of an exposure, outcome, or other variable
element.definition: The EvidenceVariable resource describes an element that knowledge (Evidence) is about.
element.comment: The EvidenceVariable may be an exposure variable (intervention, condition, or state), a measured variable (outcome or observed parameter), or other variable (such as confounding factor).

constraint.human: Name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation

element.short: Logical id of this artifact
element.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
element.comment: Within the context of the FHIR RESTful interactions, the resource has an id except for cases like the create and conditional update. Otherwise, the use of the resouce id depends on the given use case.

element.short: Metadata about the resource
element.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
element.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.
element.comment: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element. Often, when used, the URL is a reference to an implementation guide that defines these special rules as part of it's narrative along with other profiles, value sets, etc.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This element is labeled as a modifier because the implicit rules may provide additional knowledge about the resource that modifies it's meaning or interpretation

element.short: Language of the resource content
element.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
element.comment: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource. Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
element.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
element.comment: Contained resources do not have a narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative. In some cases, a resource may only have text with little or no additional discrete data (as long as all minOccurs=1 elements are satisfied).  This may be necessary for data from legacy systems where information is captured as a "text blob" or where text is additionally entered raw or narrated and encoded information is added later.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Contained, inline Resources
element.definition: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
element.comment: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again. Contained resources may have profiles and tags In their meta elements, but SHALL NOT have security labels.

element.short: Additional content defined by implementations
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored
element.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the resource that contains them

element.short: Canonical identifier for this evidence variable, represented as a URI (globally unique)
element.definition: An absolute URI that is used to identify this evidence variable when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which at which an authoritative instance of this evidence variable is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the evidence variable is stored on different servers.
element.comment:
Can be a urn:uuid: or a urn:oid: but real http: addresses are preferred.  Multiple instances may share the same URL if they have a distinct version.

The determination of when to create a new version of a resource (same url, new version) vs. defining a new artifact is up to the author.  Considerations for making this decision are found in [Technical and Business Versions](resource.html#versions). 

In some cases, the resource can no longer be found at the stated url, but the url itself cannot change. Implementations can use the [meta.source](resource.html#meta) element to indicate where the current master source of the resource can be found.
element.requirements: Allows the evidence variable to be referenced by a single globally unique identifier.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Additional identifier for the evidence variable
element.definition: A formal identifier that is used to identify this evidence variable when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.
element.comment: Typically, this is used for identifiers that can go in an HL7 V3 II (instance identifier) data type, and can then identify this evidence variable outside of FHIR, where it is not possible to use the logical URI.
element.requirements: Allows externally provided and/or usable business identifiers to be easily associated with the module.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Business version of the evidence variable
element.definition: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the evidence variable when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the evidence variable author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence. To provide a version consistent with the Decision Support Service specification, use the format Major.Minor.Revision (e.g. 1.0.0). For more information on versioning knowledge assets, refer to the Decision Support Service specification. Note that a version is required for non-experimental active artifacts.
element.comment: There may be different evidence variable instances that have the same identifier but different versions.  The version can be appended to the url in a reference to allow a reference to a particular business version of the evidence variable with the format [url]|[version].

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Name for this evidence variable (computer friendly)
element.definition: A natural language name identifying the evidence variable. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.
element.comment: The name is not expected to be globally unique. The name should be a simple alphanumeric type name to ensure that it is machine-processing friendly.
element.requirements: Support human navigation and code generation.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Name for this evidence variable (human friendly)
element.definition: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the evidence variable.
element.comment: This name does not need to be machine-processing friendly and may contain punctuation, white-space, etc.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Title for use in informal contexts
element.definition: The short title provides an alternate title for use in informal descriptive contexts where the full, formal title is not necessary.
element.requirements: Need to be able to reference the content by a short description, but still provide a longer, more formal title for the content.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Subordinate title of the EvidenceVariable
element.definition: An explanatory or alternate title for the EvidenceVariable giving additional information about its content.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: draft | active | retired | unknown
element.definition: The status of this evidence variable. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.
element.comment: Allows filtering of evidence variables that are appropriate for use versus not.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.isModifierReason: This is labeled as "Is Modifier" because applications should not use a retired {{title}} without due consideration

binding.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

element.short: For testing purposes, not real usage
element.definition: A Boolean value to indicate that this resource is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Date last changed
element.definition: The date  (and optionally time) when the evidence variable was published. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the evidence variable changes.
element.comment: Note that this is not the same as the resource last-modified-date, since the resource may be a secondary representation of the evidence variable. Additional specific dates may be added as extensions or be found by consulting Provenances associated with past versions of the resource.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Name of the publisher (organization or individual)
element.definition: The name of the organization or individual that published the evidence variable.
element.comment: Usually an organization but may be an individual. The publisher (or steward) of the evidence variable is the organization or individual primarily responsible for the maintenance and upkeep of the evidence variable. This is not necessarily the same individual or organization that developed and initially authored the content. The publisher is the primary point of contact for questions or issues with the evidence variable. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context.
element.requirements: Helps establish the "authority/credibility" of the evidence variable.  May also allow for contact.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Contact details for the publisher
element.definition: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.
element.comment: Extensions to ContactDetail include: contactReference, contactAddress, and contributionTime (Details at: http://build.fhir.org/clinicalreasoning-module.html).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Natural language description of the evidence variable
element.definition: A free text natural language description of the evidence variable from a consumer's perspective.
element.comment: This description can be used to capture details such as why the evidence variable was built, comments about misuse, instructions for clinical use and interpretation, literature references, examples from the paper world, etc. It is not a rendering of the evidence variable as conveyed in the 'text' field of the resource itself. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context (e.g. the language of the evidence variable is presumed to be the predominant language in the place the evidence variable was created).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Used for footnotes or explanatory notes
element.definition: A human-readable string to clarify or explain concepts about the resource.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: The context that the content is intended to support
element.definition: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate evidence variable instances.
element.comment: When multiple useContexts are specified, there is no expectation that all or any of the contexts apply.
element.requirements: Assist in searching for appropriate content.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Use and/or publishing restrictions
element.definition: A copyright statement relating to the resource and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the resource.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: When the resource was approved by publisher
element.definition: The date on which the resource content was approved by the publisher. Approval happens once when the content is officially approved for usage.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: When the resource was last reviewed
element.definition: The date on which the resource content was last reviewed. Review happens periodically after approval but does not change the original approval date.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: When the resource is expected to be used
element.definition: The period during which the resource content was or is planned to be in active use.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Who authored the content
element.definition: An individiual or organization primarily involved in the creation and maintenance of the content.
element.comment: Extensions to ContactDetail include: contactReference, contactAddress, and contributionTime (Details at: http://build.fhir.org/clinicalreasoning-module.html).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Who edited the content
element.definition: An individual or organization primarily responsible for internal coherence of the content.
element.comment: Extensions to ContactDetail include: contactReference, contactAddress, and contributionTime (Details at: http://build.fhir.org/clinicalreasoning-module.html).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Who reviewed the content
element.definition: An individual or organization primarily responsible for review of some aspect of the content.
element.comment: Extensions to ContactDetail include: contactReference, contactAddress, and contributionTime (Details at: http://build.fhir.org/clinicalreasoning-module.html).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: .participation[typeCode=VRF] {not clear whether VRF best corresponds to reviewer or endorser}

element.short: Who endorsed the content
element.definition: An individual or organization responsible for officially endorsing the content for use in some setting.
element.comment: Extensions to ContactDetail include: contactReference, contactAddress, and contributionTime (Details at: http://build.fhir.org/clinicalreasoning-module.html).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: .participation[typeCode=VRF] {not clear whether VRF best corresponds to reviewer or endorser}

element.short: Additional documentation, citations, etc.
element.definition: Related artifacts such as additional documentation, justification, or bibliographic references.
element.comment: Each related artifact is either an attachment, or a reference to another resource, but not both.
element.requirements: EvidenceVariables must be able to provide enough information for consumers of the content (and/or interventions or results produced by the content) to be able to determine and understand the justification for and evidence in support of the content.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Actual or conceptual
element.definition: True if the actual variable measured, false if a conceptual representation of the intended variable.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: A defining factor of the EvidenceVariable
element.definition: A defining factor of the EvidenceVariable. Multiple characteristics are applied with "and" semantics.
element.comment: Characteristics can be defined flexibly to accommodate different use cases for membership criteria, ranging from simple codes, all the way to using an expression language to express the criteria.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

In a characteristic, at most one of these seven elements shall be used: definitionReference or definitionCanonical or definitionCodeableConcept or definitionExpression or definitionId or definitionByTypeAndValue or definitionByCombination
constraint.expression: (definitionReference.count() + definitionCanonical.count() + definitionCodeableConcept.count() + definitionExpression.count() + definitionId.count() + definitionByTypeAndValue.count() + definitionByCombination.count())  < 2

element.short: Unique id for inter-element referencing
element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

element.short: Additional content defined by implementations
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.requirements: Modifier extensions allow for extensions that *cannot* be safely ignored to be clearly distinguished from the vast majority of extensions which can be safely ignored.  This promotes interoperability by eliminating the need for implementers to prohibit the presence of extensions. For further information, see the [definition of modifier extensions](extensibility.html#modifierExtension).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.isModifierReason: Modifier extensions are expected to modify the meaning or interpretation of the element that contains them

element.short: Label for internal linking
element.definition: Label used for when a characteristic refers to another characteristic.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Natural language description of the characteristic
element.definition: A short, natural language description of the characteristic that could be used to communicate the criteria to an end-user.
element.requirements: Need to be able to describe characteristics in natural language so that end users can understand the criteria.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Used for footnotes or explanatory notes
element.definition: A human-readable string to clarify or explain concepts about the characteristic.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Whether the characteristic includes or excludes members
element.definition: When true, members with this characteristic are excluded from the element.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Defines the characteristic (without using type and value) by a Reference
element.definition: Defines the characteristic using a Reference.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Defines the characteristic (without using type and value) by a Canonical
element.definition: Defines the characteristic using Canonical.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Defines the characteristic (without using type and value) by a CodeableConcept
element.definition: Defines the characteristic using CodeableConcept.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Defines the characteristic (without using type and value) by a Expression
element.definition: Defines the characteristic using Expression.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Defines the characteristic (without using type and value) by a id
element.definition: Defines the characteristic using id.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Defines the characteristic using type and value
element.definition: Defines the characteristic using both a type[x] and value[x] elements.

element.short: Expresses the type of characteristic
element.definition: Used to express the type of characteristic.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Defines the characteristic when coupled with characteristic.type[x]
element.definition: Defines the characteristic when paired with characteristic.type[x].

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Reference point for valueQuantity
element.definition: Defines the reference point for comparison when valueQuantity is not compared to zero.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Used to specify how two or more characteristics are combined
element.definition: Defines the characteristic as a combination of two or more characteristics.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.short: Description of the grouping
element.definition: Description of the grouping.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Definition of the grouping
element.definition: Definition of the grouping.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: A definition of an exposure, outcome, or other variable
element.definition: The EvidenceVariable resource describes an element that knowledge (Evidence) is about.
element.comment: The EvidenceVariable may be an exposure variable (intervention, condition, or state), a measured variable (outcome or observed parameter), or other variable (such as confounding factor).

constraint.human: Name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation

element.short: Canonical identifier for this evidence variable, represented as a URI (globally unique)
element.definition: An absolute URI that is used to identify this evidence variable when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which at which an authoritative instance of this evidence variable is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the evidence variable is stored on different servers.
element.comment:
Can be a urn:uuid: or a urn:oid: but real http: addresses are preferred.  Multiple instances may share the same URL if they have a distinct version.

The determination of when to create a new version of a resource (same url, new version) vs. defining a new artifact is up to the author.  Considerations for making this decision are found in [Technical and Business Versions](resource.html#versions). 

In some cases, the resource can no longer be found at the stated url, but the url itself cannot change. Implementations can use the [meta.source](resource.html#meta) element to indicate where the current master source of the resource can be found.
element.requirements: Allows the evidence variable to be referenced by a single globally unique identifier.

element.short: Additional identifier for the evidence variable
element.definition: A formal identifier that is used to identify this evidence variable when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.
element.comment: Typically, this is used for identifiers that can go in an HL7 V3 II (instance identifier) data type, and can then identify this evidence variable outside of FHIR, where it is not possible to use the logical URI.
element.requirements: Allows externally provided and/or usable business identifiers to be easily associated with the module.

element.short: Business version of the evidence variable
element.definition: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the evidence variable when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the evidence variable author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence. To provide a version consistent with the Decision Support Service specification, use the format Major.Minor.Revision (e.g. 1.0.0). For more information on versioning knowledge assets, refer to the Decision Support Service specification. Note that a version is required for non-experimental active artifacts.
element.comment: There may be different evidence variable instances that have the same identifier but different versions.  The version can be appended to the url in a reference to allow a reference to a particular business version of the evidence variable with the format [url]|[version].

element.short: Name for this evidence variable (computer friendly)
element.definition: A natural language name identifying the evidence variable. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.
element.comment: The name is not expected to be globally unique. The name should be a simple alphanumeric type name to ensure that it is machine-processing friendly.
element.requirements: Support human navigation and code generation.

element.short: Name for this evidence variable (human friendly)
element.definition: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the evidence variable.
element.comment: This name does not need to be machine-processing friendly and may contain punctuation, white-space, etc.

element.short: Title for use in informal contexts
element.definition: The short title provides an alternate title for use in informal descriptive contexts where the full, formal title is not necessary.
element.requirements: Need to be able to reference the content by a short description, but still provide a longer, more formal title for the content.

element.short: Subordinate title of the EvidenceVariable
element.definition: An explanatory or alternate title for the EvidenceVariable giving additional information about its content.

element.short: draft | active | retired | unknown
element.definition: The status of this evidence variable. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.
element.comment: Allows filtering of evidence variables that are appropriate for use versus not.
element.isModifierReason: This is labeled as "Is Modifier" because applications should not use a retired {{title}} without due consideration

binding.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

element.short: For testing purposes, not real usage
element.definition: A Boolean value to indicate that this resource is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

element.short: Date last changed
element.definition: The date  (and optionally time) when the evidence variable was published. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the evidence variable changes.
element.comment: Note that this is not the same as the resource last-modified-date, since the resource may be a secondary representation of the evidence variable. Additional specific dates may be added as extensions or be found by consulting Provenances associated with past versions of the resource.

element.short: Name of the publisher (organization or individual)
element.definition: The name of the organization or individual that published the evidence variable.
element.comment: Usually an organization but may be an individual. The publisher (or steward) of the evidence variable is the organization or individual primarily responsible for the maintenance and upkeep of the evidence variable. This is not necessarily the same individual or organization that developed and initially authored the content. The publisher is the primary point of contact for questions or issues with the evidence variable. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context.
element.requirements: Helps establish the "authority/credibility" of the evidence variable.  May also allow for contact.

element.short: Contact details for the publisher
element.definition: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.
element.comment: Extensions to ContactDetail include: contactReference, contactAddress, and contributionTime (Details at: http://build.fhir.org/clinicalreasoning-module.html).

element.short: Natural language description of the evidence variable
element.definition: A free text natural language description of the evidence variable from a consumer's perspective.
element.comment: This description can be used to capture details such as why the evidence variable was built, comments about misuse, instructions for clinical use and interpretation, literature references, examples from the paper world, etc. It is not a rendering of the evidence variable as conveyed in the 'text' field of the resource itself. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context (e.g. the language of the evidence variable is presumed to be the predominant language in the place the evidence variable was created).

element.short: Used for footnotes or explanatory notes
element.definition: A human-readable string to clarify or explain concepts about the resource.

element.short: The context that the content is intended to support
element.definition: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate evidence variable instances.
element.comment: When multiple useContexts are specified, there is no expectation that all or any of the contexts apply.
element.requirements: Assist in searching for appropriate content.

element.short: Use and/or publishing restrictions
element.definition: A copyright statement relating to the resource and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the resource.

element.short: When the resource was approved by publisher
element.definition: The date on which the resource content was approved by the publisher. Approval happens once when the content is officially approved for usage.

element.short: When the resource was last reviewed
element.definition: The date on which the resource content was last reviewed. Review happens periodically after approval but does not change the original approval date.

element.short: When the resource is expected to be used
element.definition: The period during which the resource content was or is planned to be in active use.

element.short: Who authored the content
element.definition: An individiual or organization primarily involved in the creation and maintenance of the content.
element.comment: Extensions to ContactDetail include: contactReference, contactAddress, and contributionTime (Details at: http://build.fhir.org/clinicalreasoning-module.html).

element.short: Who edited the content
element.definition: An individual or organization primarily responsible for internal coherence of the content.
element.comment: Extensions to ContactDetail include: contactReference, contactAddress, and contributionTime (Details at: http://build.fhir.org/clinicalreasoning-module.html).

element.short: Who reviewed the content
element.definition: An individual or organization primarily responsible for review of some aspect of the content.
element.comment: Extensions to ContactDetail include: contactReference, contactAddress, and contributionTime (Details at: http://build.fhir.org/clinicalreasoning-module.html).

mapping.map: .participation[typeCode=VRF] {not clear whether VRF best corresponds to reviewer or endorser}

element.short: Who endorsed the content
element.definition: An individual or organization responsible for officially endorsing the content for use in some setting.
element.comment: Extensions to ContactDetail include: contactReference, contactAddress, and contributionTime (Details at: http://build.fhir.org/clinicalreasoning-module.html).

mapping.map: .participation[typeCode=VRF] {not clear whether VRF best corresponds to reviewer or endorser}

element.short: Additional documentation, citations, etc.
element.definition: Related artifacts such as additional documentation, justification, or bibliographic references.
element.comment: Each related artifact is either an attachment, or a reference to another resource, but not both.
element.requirements: EvidenceVariables must be able to provide enough information for consumers of the content (and/or interventions or results produced by the content) to be able to determine and understand the justification for and evidence in support of the content.

element.short: Actual or conceptual
element.definition: True if the actual variable measured, false if a conceptual representation of the intended variable.

element.short: A defining factor of the EvidenceVariable
element.definition: A defining factor of the EvidenceVariable. Multiple characteristics are applied with "and" semantics.
element.comment: Characteristics can be defined flexibly to accommodate different use cases for membership criteria, ranging from simple codes, all the way to using an expression language to express the criteria.

constraint.human: In a characteristic, at most one of these seven elements shall be used: definitionReference or definitionCanonical or definitionCodeableConcept or definitionExpression or definitionId or definitionByTypeAndValue or definitionByCombination
constraint.expression: (definitionReference.count() + definitionCanonical.count() + definitionCodeableConcept.count() + definitionExpression.count() + definitionId.count() + definitionByTypeAndValue.count() + definitionByCombination.count())  < 2

element.short: Label for internal linking
element.definition: Label used for when a characteristic refers to another characteristic.

element.short: Natural language description of the characteristic
element.definition: A short, natural language description of the characteristic that could be used to communicate the criteria to an end-user.
element.requirements: Need to be able to describe characteristics in natural language so that end users can understand the criteria.

element.short: Used for footnotes or explanatory notes
element.definition: A human-readable string to clarify or explain concepts about the characteristic.

element.short: Whether the characteristic includes or excludes members
element.definition: When true, members with this characteristic are excluded from the element.

element.short: Defines the characteristic (without using type and value) by a Reference
element.definition: Defines the characteristic using a Reference.

element.short: Defines the characteristic (without using type and value) by a Canonical
element.definition: Defines the characteristic using Canonical.

element.short: Defines the characteristic (without using type and value) by a CodeableConcept
element.definition: Defines the characteristic using CodeableConcept.

element.short: Defines the characteristic (without using type and value) by a Expression
element.definition: Defines the characteristic using Expression.

element.short: Defines the characteristic (without using type and value) by a id
element.definition: Defines the characteristic using id.

element.short: Defines the characteristic using type and value
element.definition: Defines the characteristic using both a type[x] and value[x] elements.

element.short: Expresses the type of characteristic
element.definition: Used to express the type of characteristic.

element.short: Defines the characteristic when coupled with characteristic.type[x]
element.definition: Defines the characteristic when paired with characteristic.type[x].

element.short: Reference point for valueQuantity
element.definition: Defines the reference point for comparison when valueQuantity is not compared to zero.

element.short: Used to specify how two or more characteristics are combined
element.definition: Defines the characteristic as a combination of two or more characteristics.

element.short: all-of | any-of | at-least | at-most | statistical | net-effect | dataset
element.definition: Used to specify if two or more characteristics are combined with OR or AND.
element.requirements: If code is "at-least" or "at-most" then threshold SHALL be used. If code is neither "at-least" nor "at-most" then threshold SHALL NOT be used.

element.short: Provides the value of "n" when "at-least" or "at-most" codes are used
element.definition: Provides the value of "n" when "at-least" or "at-most" codes are used.

element.short: A defining factor of the characteristic
element.definition: A defining factor of the characteristic.

element.short: Method used for describing characteristic
element.definition: Method used for describing characteristic.

binding.description: The method used to determine the characteristic(s) of the variable.

element.short: Device used for determining characteristic
element.definition: Device used for determining characteristic.

element.short: Observation time from study specified event
element.definition: Observation time from study specified event.

element.short: Human readable description
element.definition: Human readable description.

element.short: Used for footnotes or explanatory notes
element.definition: A human-readable string to clarify or explain concepts about the timeFromEvent.

element.short: The event used as a base point (reference point) in time
element.definition: The event used as a base point (reference point) in time.

element.short: Used to express the observation at a defined amount of time after the study start
element.definition: Used to express the observation at a defined amount of time after the study start.

element.short: Used to express the observation within a period after the study start
element.definition: Used to express the observation within a period after the study start.

element.short: mean | median | mean-of-mean | mean-of-median | median-of-mean | median-of-median
element.definition: Value or set of values that define the grouping.

element.short: continuous | dichotomous | ordinal | polychotomous
element.definition: The method of handling in statistical analysis.

element.short: A grouping for ordinal or polychotomous variables
element.definition: A grouping for ordinal or polychotomous variables.

element.short: Description of the grouping
element.definition: Description of the grouping.

element.short: Definition of the grouping
element.definition: Definition of the grouping.
